*div1 type="summary"* *p*Nathaniel Cox to Austin, July 20, 1825. Concerning cotton trade between Texas and New Orleans.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="07-20-1825">20. July 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dear Sir,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Mr. Carter*/person_mentioned* arrived after a tedious passage of 35 days and delivered your favour of the *date_mentioned n="06-02-1825">2 June*/date_mentioned*— It will afford me much pleasure to be usefull to him or any of your *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*, and *person_mentioned*settlers*/person_mentioned*.*/p*
*p*I have had much conversation with *person_mentioned*Mr Carter*/person_mentioned* on the subject of your *location_mentioned*settlement*/location_mentioned*, and the probable trade with *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned* It will however require a vessel of larger dimensions than the sloop Robert to bring cotton I apprehend— Our laws dont authorise smaller vessels than 30 Tons to Introduce *location_mentioned*foureign */location_mentioned*Goods—*/p*
*p*Your cotton can be entered here for Export and thereby save the duties—I send you some blanks which will be required in case of making shipment to this place— In case of no *person_mentioned*American Consul*/person_mentioned* Two *person_mentioned*Merchants */person_mentioned*must sign the Certificate of Landing—*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Nath: Cox*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Col S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Brassos*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
